definitions: To improve the hardness and elasticity of (steel or other metal) by reheating and then cooling it.
To act as a neutralizing or counterbalancing force to (something).
To moderate or mitigate (a quality or feeling); to make less extreme.
To bring (clay or mortar) to a proper consistency by moistening and mixing.
examples: The blacksmith will temper the blade.
He tried to temper his criticism with praise.
Her calm demeanor helped to temper the tense atmosphere.
The potter needs to temper the clay before molding it.
